title: Beethoven: The man who freed music
Library of Congress lectures II
description: Lectures and readings from the Library of Congress, 1967-68 season. This prog.: Poetry readings and discussions with James Dickey, moderator, and participants Ben Belitt and John Frederick Nims.

title: The American town: A self-portrait
description: Historical documentary series drawn from the recollections of senior citizens in a variety of American towns.

title: Gateway to ideas
description: This discussion series, produced by the American Library Association, features noted authors, critics and scholars on various topics.

title: The negro American
description: Lecture series by Prof. Benjamin Quarles of Morgan State College, Baltimore, made in late 1967 in Detroit Public Schools. The Negro American series covers one topic each week. This prog.: Why Study Negro History?

title: Speaking of Mexico
description: Panel discussion series about Mexico.

title: The old record box II
description: Musical and speaking selections played from cylinder records dated from the late 1890s to about 1929. This prog.: Sampler: Happy Birds, Where the Sunset turns the Ocean's Blue to Gold, Uncle Josh and the Ligtning Rod Agent, Dardanelle, Rockabye Your Baby

title: Meet Mr. Emerson
description: Meet Mr. Emerson. No information available.

title: Search for mental health
description: A series of talks about the latest advances in psychiatry by staff members of Forest Hospital near Chicago.

title: Backgrounds of music
description: Hosted by John Brownlee, this series seeks to provide in-depth discussion of important music.

title: The yankee dollar
description: A documentary series on impact of U.S. dollar on Latin America, especially Mexico. Ther series is hosted by Richard Arellano.

title: Security and civil rights
description: Interviews on balancing national security interests with personal liberty.  The series is moderated by Monrad Paulsen of Columbia University.

title: Teach-in on Vietnam
description: Highlights of 15-hour debate on U.S. policy in Viet Nam and Southeast Asia: The National Teach-In on Viet Nam in Washington, D.C.

title: Peace, love, creativity: Hope of mankind
Urban frontier
description: Each program in this series considers one of the major life activities people carry on in an urban setting.  The format is narrative with dramatized interludes.

title: Smoke?
description: Series on smoking and health; approved by the American Cancer Society.

title: Search for new values
description: The series presents speeches by leading figures in science.

title: Pathways to progress: The Great Lakes
description: A 13-part documentary drama about the economic impact of the Great Lakes region in the United State.

title: Impetus
description: A program about books that have given shape to the 20th century.

title: Music from Rochester
description: A series of concerts from the University of Rochester's Eastman School of Music, featuring students and faculty as performers and composers. Recordings of concerts from 1968-69. No other information available.

title: The American journal
description: This is an informal, "magazine" style interview series on the fine arts.

title: This was Toscanini
description: A documentary honoring the 100th anniversary of the birth of conductor Arturo Toscanini, hosted by Brigette Paolucci.

title: Classical drama
description: This series presents full-length productions of Greek and Roman plays of antiquity in modern English translation with original music especially composed for this series.  Each play is introduced by William Arrowsmith of the University of Texas.

title: Ethic for broadcasting
description: This series presents interviews that center on issues in broadcasting and society.

title: Jazz of the past
description: This series, hosted by Lenny Kessel, presents selections from various rare jazz albums.

title: Ways of mankind
description: This series is an exploration into the origin and development of cultures, customs and folkways in various parts of the world.

title: BBC world theater
description: This series presents performances of great plays, both classic and modern.

title: Human sexuality
description: This series features lectures given as part of a class on human sexuality.

title: News in twentieth century America
description: A series of documentaries on the gathering, writing and dissemination of news in this country today, compiled from interviews with journalists. Guests in this series include H.V. Kaltenborn, Roy Larsen, John Daly, Douglass Cater, Drew Pearson, Quincy Howe, Mike Wallace, Norman Cousins, David Brinkley, James Hagerty, Howard K. Smith, Marquis Childs, Merriman Smith, Gilbert Seldes, Fulton Lewis, Jr., Sig Mickelson, H.R. Baukhage, Roscoe Drummond, and many others.

title: The art of Emanuel Feuermann
description: Series exploring artistry of cellist Emanuel Feuermann, including historic recordings. The series is hosted by Seymour Itzkoff of Smith College.

title: 1970 May festival
description: The 1970 May Festival from Music Hall in Cincinnati, Ohio. The festival featured the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra and other performers.

title: Hold your breath
description: This series focuses on air pollution and its impact on America.

title: How's the family
description: Drama with comment, designed to show in an entertaining way how important the family is to the people in it.

title: Hard travelin'
description: A series about Woody Guthrie and his Depression-era folk music.

title: The music of Don Gillis III
description: This series spotlights the works of American composer Don Gillis and is hosted by the man himself.

title: Indian country
description: The problems of social adjustment in the attitudes and through the words of the modern Native Americans.

title: NER concerts
description: National Educational Radio presents a series of recorded concerts.

title: U.S.-U.S.S.R. exchange programs
description: A series of program created within the Soviet Union for listeners in the United States. It is produced as part of a Soviet-American agreement for cultural exchange.

title: The diary of Samuel Pepys
description: This series dramatizes portions of the diary of Samuel Pepys, an English naval administrator who provided invaluable writings from the English Restoration period.

title: American woman in fact and fiction
description: Thirteen half-hour programs illustrating with dramatization the changing status of women in America from colonial times to the present day, plus a one-hour panel discussion on modern-day problems.

title: Aspects of mental health
description: A documentary series on the role of behavioral sciences and medical research.

title: Evolution of jazz
description: Jazz historian Nat Hentoff presents a series that traces the history of jazz, from its musical and cultural roots to its contemporary forms.

title: H is for joy
description: A documentary series about the nature of drug addiction, the current status of addiction, and various programs of prevention and treatment. Participants in the series include Dr. Rafael S. Gamso; Meyer Diskind of New York State Board of Parole; and Joseph Fiedoral, a Chicago policeman.

title: Organ music of the centuries
description: Highlights of noted organ music selections from various periods, including Pre-Baroque and Baroque; Classical and Romantic; and Modern.

title: Sexuality: a search for perspective
description: A series of lectures from an interdisciplinary colloquy on human sexuality, held on the campus of Michigan State University.

title: Portrait of the American
description: Series that examines assessments of the American using the themes of innocence, affluence, success and the American self. Features analysis by Dr. Betty Ch'maj, interviews, dramatic readings. Series features interviews with John Dos Passos, James Farmer, Marshall Fishwick, Alan Harrington, Ihab Hassan, Irving Howe, Alfred Kazin, R.W.B. Lewis, and William H. Whyte, Jr.

title: The V.D. epidemic
description: A series about a venereal disease epidemic in the 1960s, especially among teenagers.

title: Politics in the twentieth century
description: This series consists of moderated panel discussions on American political affairs in the mid-20th century. It features Samuel Lubell, Professor Charles Nixon and others.

title: Middle East crisis
description: A panel discussion sponsored June 1, 1967, by University of Chicago Center for Policy Study. Participants: Leonard Binder and William R. Polk of University of Chicago, Tahseen Bashir of Arab States Delegation, Benjamin Halpern of Brandeis University.

title: What must be done
description: Discussions about solutions to problems affecting ghetto, urban areas, race relations. Moderated by Percy Sutton, Manhattan Borough President. This prog.: Osborn Elliott, Dr. Nathan Wright, James Farmer, Eldridge Waith. See also next entry for info.

title: Senate hearings on public broadcasting
description: Senate Hearings on Public Broadcasting Act of 1967, held during April 1967.

title: Organization for economic cooperation and development
description: This series, narrated by John F. Lewis, presents a report on the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD).

title: Tales of the valiant
description: Dramatic stories of great national heroes outside the English-speaking world.

title: The American cowboy
description: Documentary series on the American cowboy, produced by the University of Texas.

title: The Presidency: 1968
description: Lectures on the 1968 U.S. Presidential campaign by political scientist Max Lerner of Brandeis U. Presented in late 1968 at Garland Junior College in Boston. This prog.: The Candidates: Style and Character

title: Some American worthies
description: Profiles of curious figures in the American past, based on diaries, journals and other books of personal record.  The speaker is Robert E. Streeter, a professor of English at the University of Chicago.

title: The music makers
description: Distinguished Americans discuss their profession of music, from composition to criticism; the business of music and its current place in our national culture.

title: New directions in social sciences
description: A series of talks delivered before the annual convention of the American Psychological Association in San Francisco.

title: The legendary pianists II
description: Music by great early-twentieth century concert pianists who produced Duo-Art piano roll recordings before advent of electronic recording.

title: Reader's almanac
description: A literature series featuring interviews with authors, poets, and others in the literary world.

title: A question of art
description: Series featuring discussion of controversial aspects of modern and contemporary art. Panelists: Lawrence Alloway, former curator of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum in New York City; Gerhart Magnus, Southern Illinois U.; Walter Richter, WSIU. Modern art.

title: What a piece of work is a man
description: Aldous Huxley presents a lecture series in which he asks, "how did our ancestors think of human nature and in what terms ought we to think about it?"

title: Detroit Symphony Orchestra
description: Detroit Symphony Orchestra concert series, recorded at the Ford Auditorium on the Detroit Riverfront.

title: 1959 Couchiching conference
description: The 31st edition of an annual meeting held in Geneva Park, Ontario. Political matters are discussed, with an emphasis on how they relate to Canada. This edition focuses on "The New Europe."

title: The Wailing Wall
description: The Wailing Wall. No other information available.

title: What about you?
description: An educational program designed to illustrate the dangers of cigarette smoking for young people.

title: New England anthology
description: A series featuring New England poets who read and discuss their own works.

title: Make history your hobby
description: This series provides detail and analysis of important historical figures and events.

title: Dimensions of a new age
description: This series explores the new developments and challenges that have emerged in the wake of the "space age" that occurred in the mid-20th century.

title: Minds of men
description: A series of explorations into effective living, combining dramatizations with commentary.

title: Creative method
description: This companion series for The Creative Mind presents radio essays on a creative activity by an outstanding representative of that activity. Dr. Lyman Bryson hosts.

title: Atoms for power
description: This 15-part series discusses the feasibility of atomic power as an alternate energy source to replace depleted fossil fuels.

title: The merry adventures of Robin Hood
The Jeffersonian heritage
description: This series dramatizes the ideas of Thomas Jefferson, which are"the enduring possessions of all Americans and all free peoples," while being "authentic in historical spirit" and "imaginative in form."

title: America on stage
description: Selected American plays written prior to 1900.  Each is an expression of contemporary popular sentiments.  Radio adaptations of theatre performances, using selected excerpts.

title: Exploring the child's world II
description: Interviews with delinquent and disturbed young people who are encouraged to discuss their experiences and express feelings. To protect individuals, each program is a re-creation of an actual interview using different names and places.

title: The theory and practice of communism
description: Series of lectures by Michael Petrovich, prof. of history at the U. of Wisconsin at the University Alumni Seminar. This prog.: The Nature and Importance of Communism.

title: They fought alone
description: Drama series on pioneering individuals produced at University of Michigan

title: Seminar: Big Sur
description: Discussion and lecture series from Esalen Institute at Big Sur, Calif., headed by Michael H. Murphy devoted to exploring the psychological nature of man.

title: The glory road
description: The stories of African-Americans who have helped make the United States what it is today.

title: Music in the making
description: Instructional comments and musical illustrations using faculty and students from the Millikin University School of Music. The first thirteen programs in the series focus upon historical aspects of music. The second half of the series explores music's technical side.

title: Tender twigs
description: This series discusses problems affecting today's youth, such as mental health, delinquency, crime, social pressures. It also considers solutions for parents and youths to employ.

title: Poetry in song III
description: This series presents outstanding musical settings of poetry and literary anthologies, integrating the worlds of music and literature.

title: Bluegrass and mountains
description: Recordings of and talk about a wide variety of old time American music.

title: Opera: Battleground of the arts
description: A discussion series, hosted by Boris Goldovsky, that examines the welding together of music and drama, two distinct arts, into opera.

title: Fifty years of growth
description: A series of documentaries on industrial change in the U.S.

title: Man is not a thing
description: This series presents a discussion of the discoveries and errors of Sigmund Freud and his impact on the American family, politics and religion.

title: Library of Congress lectures
description: A series of lectures given at the Library of Congress in Washington, D.C.

title: Audition reel
description: Audition reels that were distributed to promote new radio programs on the National Association of Educational Broadcasters network.

title: What is modern poetry
description: This series presents lectures with readings of poems.  It strives to discuss and define modern poetry in a non-technical way.  Text is read by Professor Alan Simpson of the University of Chicago; poetry is read by members of University Radio Theatre.

title: Doctor tell me
description: Weekly interviews with a Minneapolis-St. Paul area doctor about a current medical issue. Interviews conducted by Audrey June Booth of KUOM (Radio station : Minneapolis, Minn.) .

title: Your doctor speaks II
description: U. of Illinois Medical Center in Chicago faculty members talk about medical matters of concern. This prog.: Epilepsy: Is there a problem? Dr. Louis Boshes

title: In memoriam: Langston Hughes
description: A series about the noted American poet who died May 22, 1967. It features him reading his poetry at Columbia University during Spring 1964.

title: New aspects of language
description: Discussion series about linguistics, featuring students and faculty from Nashville University Center, led by Dr. Gerd Fraenkel of the George Peabody College for Teachers. Produced by WPLN, Nashville Public Library. This prog.: Modern Linguistics

title: Operation Airlift: 20th anniversary
description: Documentary in observance of 20th anniversary of June, 1948, Berlin Airlift, breaking the Soviet blockade. Produced by Deutsche Welle.

title: Georgetown forum
description: Moderated by Wallace Fanning, this series presents a panel of guests discussing a variety of topics. The radio series launched in 1946. It also later aired on WTTG-TV in Washington, D.C. These programs aired 1968-69.

title: China today
description: A series focused on current events in China, as well as the interactions between the governments of China and the United States.

title: Report from Russia
description: E.W. Ziebarth, Dean of the summer session at University of Minnesota, and ten other faculty members embarked upon a month-long trip through the Soviet Union. Ziebarth interviewed his peers about their thoughts on the trip.

title: Seminars in theatre
description: A weekly panel discussion series on the theatre scene in New York City, moderated by Richard Pyatt.

title: People talk back
description: This series presents a series of questions posed to politicians about current affairs.

title: 1965 National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention
1961 Couchiching conference
description: The 1961 Couchiching Conference, a summer symposium on national and international affairs put together by the Canadian Institute on Public Affairs and the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, assembles for its 30th annual meeting. The theme of the 1961 conference was "diplomacy in evolution."

title: Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra 1970
description: This series features live performances from the 1970 season by the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra .

title: Beyond Vietnam
description: A speech by Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., given at Riverside Church in New York City, April 4, 1967, and sponsored by Clergy and Laymen Concerned About Vietnam.

title: Prison document
description: A documentary series that examines prisons and their purposes.

title: P.M.
description: PM, sometimes referred to as the PM programme to avoid ambiguity, is BBC Radio 4's long-running early evening news and current affairs programme.

title: Prepare for survival
description: A radio sounding board for facts and opinions on civil defense.

title: Ideas and the Theatre
description: The series presents a discussion of the current American theatre; its values, beliefs, patterns, and problems. Participants include Arthur Miller, Eric Bentley, Gore Vidal, Brooks Atkinson, Cyril Ritchard, Clinton Wilder, Tennessee Williams, and others.

title: Chicago Contemporary Chamber Players
description: This series presents concert performances from the Chicago Contemporary Chamber Players.

title: 1960 Couchiching conference
description: The 1960 Couchiching Conference, a summer symposium on national and international affairs put together by the Canadian Institute on Public Affairs and the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, assembles for its 29th annual meeting. The theme of the 1960 conference was "The Latin Americas."

title: When disaster strikes
description: This series focuses on disaster preparation, as well as the effects wrought by disaster.

title: Unfinished business
description: A series of programs designed to acquaint listeners with unresolved social welfare problems.

title: Everybody's mountain
description: A series on educational leadership and imagination in the United States today.

title: Patrioscript
description: A series of 13 patriotic plays by professional freelance writers as edited and directed by Herbert Prescott with the Grinnell College Radio Players.

title: For friendship
description: About the Boy Scouts of America 12th World Jamboree, held August 1-9, 1967, at Farragut State Park in Idaho.

title: Negro music in America
description: This series focuses on music created and performed by African-Americans, including folk, and jazz styles. This series is hosted by Anton Luckenbach of Carbondale, Illinois, who also gathered interviews in New Orleans for this series.

title: Business review
description: This series, hosted by Ross Wilhelm, focuses on current news stories that relate to business and economic activity.

title: The music of Don Gillis
description: This series features the works of Don Gillis; hosted by the composer himself. Most of the performances are conducted by the composer.

title: Light unto my path
description: This series explores the books of the Old Testament, how they were written, how they were preserved, and why they continue to have influence.

title: Medical research
description: This series explores current developments in research in the fields of the behavioral sciences and medicine.

title: Los Angeles Philharmonic
description: This series features concert performances by the Los Angeles Philharmonic orchestra.

title: Document:  Deep South
description: A series of documentaries depicting the increasing importance of the South in the economic development of the United States. Narrated by Walt Whitaker, written and produced by Leroy Bannerman, with Dr. Walter B. Jones as senior consultant.

title: Writer as critic
description: Discussions with authors about their subjects and methods.

title: Creative mind
description: This series, hosted by Lyman Bryson, presents radio essays about the creative process for the American artist and scientist in the 20th century.

title: Intellectual adventure of ancient man
description: This series, based onThorkild Jacobsen's book, "The Intellectual Adventure of Ancient Man," seeks to describe the "good life in ancient Mesopotamia."

title: Dwight MacDonald on film
description: Series of lectures by Dwight MacDonald on film: its makers, its history, its future.

title: Contemporary revolution in Latin America
description: A documentary series on problems facing Latin America, including panel discussions at program conclusion. The series is hosted by Erwin Canham, editor at the Christian Science Monitor.

title: Puccini and his work
description: The story behind Puccini's opera, "Madama  Butterfly."

title: New England renaissance
description: A dramatic re-creation of the New England Renaissance produced at Boston University. In this part of the series, the Transcendentalists are viewed from the perspective of 1954, when this program was recorded.

title: The Music of Don Gillis II
description: This series features the works of Don Gillis; hosted by the composer himself. Most of the performances are conducted by the composer.

title: One nation indivisible
description: A documentary series about nationalism in the 20th century.

title: Poetry and the American
description: Twenty half-hour programs designed to further the enjoyment of poetry.

title: American adventure
description: This series studies the values and characteristics of notable figures from America's early years. A study of man in the New World: his values and characteristics, who he is, what he lives by. It is written by John M. Ehle and directed by John S. Clayton.

title: Latin American perspectives II
description: Series of lectures by Dr. C. Harvey Gardiner, prof. of history at Southern Illinois U., each program based on a book or magazine article. See also series 68-3. This prog.: The Politics of Exile by Paul H. Lewis

title: Donald P. Kent memorial lecture
description: The Donald P. Kent Memorial Award is given annually to a member of the Gerontological Society of America. The award winner then delivers a lecture related to the subject of gerontology.

title: Toward a new world
description: Lectures recorded at San Diego State College's 25th Annual Institute on World Affairs. The Institute brings together world leaders to discuss issues in politics, culture, science, and more.

title: BBC world report
description: British Broadcasting Corporation World Report #374, recorded May 20, 1969. Topic: World Communists Meet June 5, 1969. Host: Bruce Tulloch.

title: American language
description: A series of talks by Mitford Mathews, editor of the Dictionary of Americanisms and lecturer in linguistics at the University of Chicago.

title: Seeds of discontent
description: Documentary series addressing: race relations, civil rights, poverty, youth, crime, deliquency. Host: Hartford Smith, Jr., Michigan Dept of Social Services and Wayne State U. This prog.: Smith visits a "hippie pad" and explores communal living.

title: American composer
description: Original works by American composers commissioned for this series. The compositions are meant to highlight important American holidays or seasonal observances.

title: The Olympic Games 1968
description: British Broadcasting Corporation interview series about the October, 1968, Olympics at Mexico City. Includes interviews with athletes Jim Ryun, Ron Clark, Gaston Roelants, Elaine Tanner, Bobby McGregor. This prog.: Troubled Olympics: Altitude, Amateurism and Politics

title: House hearings on public broadcasting
description: A report on the House Commerce Committee hearings on the Public Broadcasting Act of 1967.

title: Exploring the child's world IV
description: Interviews with delinquent and disturbed young people who are encouraged to discuss their experiences and express feelings. To protect individuals, each program is a re-creation of an actual interview using different names and places.

title: People under communism
description: A series of documentaries, interviews and talks based upon documented evidence and expert knowledge about the power and intentions of the Soviet Union.

title: The old record box
description: Cylinder recordings of music and spoken word from late 1890's to 1929; historic recordings of music and speech.

title: Artist speaks
description: Leading artists of the time speak about their own works.

title: The multiversity today
description: Series about today's large university and its complexities and problems as seen by students, faculty, alumni and employees. This prog.: Where Did It Come From? Highlighting the first universities and how they developed in the U.S., and their current goals

title: Success in the arts
description: This series presents panel discussions that focus on various aspects of the arts, including the skills needed to excel. The series is moderated by Studs Terkel and produced by Alfred E. Partridge.

title: Negro spiritual
description: Talks by Rolf Cahn, folksinger and musicologist, with music from records, including replays from old collections.

title: Public Broadcasting Act of 1967
description: A panel discussion on the Public Broadcasting Act of 1967. Moderated by Edgar Willis, former program associate for National Educational Television. Panelists: Edwin Burrows; Ben Yablonki; and William Pearce.

title: Sibelius centenary
description: To commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Finnish composer Jean Sibelius' birth, this program focuses on his works.

title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters convention highlights
description: Highlights of the November 1968 convention of the National Association of Educational Broadcasters in Washington, D.C. This program features a keynote address by McGeorge Bundy, president, Ford Foundation. "The Fifth Freedom."

title: The challenge of aging
description: Part of a WUOM series on human behavior, this series seeks to explore the challenges facing the aged.

title: The African revolution
description: A six-part study of Sub-Saharan Africa, based on a fifteen-country tour that was undertaken by broadcaster Harry Ruskie.

title: The legendary pianists
description: Music by great early-twentieth century concert pianists who produced Duo-Art piano roll recordings before advent of electronic recording.

title: The Middle East War
description: A series of five 10-minute analyses of the Six-Day War by British Broadcasting Corporation Middle East correspondent James Thompson.

title: Listen to the land
description: America's literary heritage is explored through readings of short stories, poems, folklore, journalism and legends. A profile of a nation in terms of its living language. By sharing aloud the writings of the United States, past and present, a fuller appreciation of what it means to be American can be found. The series is narrated by Richard S. Burdick.

title: Egoist in tragedy
description: Three lectures by David Grene, poet, translator, and Professor in the Committee on Social Thought, University of Chicago.  He discusses a particular kind of tragedy and focuses on three examples.

title: Visiting scholars
description: This series features interviews with outstanding scholars from various fields.

title: Comment on a minority
description: This series explores minority issues in the United States in the mid-20th century.

title: Washington report
description: A weekly news report produced in Washington, D.C. for stations of the National Association of Educational Broadcasters.

title: Century of science
description: A recorded exploration of science and its importance to the 20th century American. Discussions of aspects of science affecting modern America. This series is hosted by Volta Torrey, the director of radio and television programming at Massachusetts Institute of Technology, as well as the former editor of Popular Science.

title: Konrad Adenauer specials
description: Special programming commemorating the life of Konrad Adenauer, chancellor of West Germany from 1949 to 1963.

title: Recital hall
description: Outstanding musical performances from University of Texas faculty and students, as well as guest performers.

title: Child beyond
description: Documentary-drama with discussions by child-care experts about exceptional children, both handicapped and gifted.

title: Latin American perspectives
description: A series of comment and analysis about current affairs in Latin American countries.

title: The LaSalle String Quartet II
description: This series presents performances by the La Salle Quartet of Cincinnati, Ohio.

title: Ways of mankind II
description: This series is an exploration into the origin and development of cultures, customs and folkways in various parts of the world. The second series of Ways Of Mankind is concerned with a specific subject area and with two specific cultures.

title: Over the back fence and Transatlantic profile
Music around the world
description: This series, hosted by Marta Nicholas, presents music from all parts of the globe.

title: Business roundtable
description: A program of current comment from leading members of America's business community.

title: American composer
description: Original works by American composers commissioned for this series. The compositions are meant to highlight important American holidays or seasonal observances.

title: The only way to fly
description: Series about the safety aspects of commercial airlines. Host: Edward Baron of WBFO. This prog.: Regulations and standards in the airline industry. A.J. Behrens of the Flight Standards Division, Federal Aviation Administration.

title: Assembly for Human Rights: Montreal
description: Highlights from the Assembly for Human Rights held in 1968 at Montreal. This prog.: Recent Progress in Human Rights and Main Challenges Ahead. Louis B. Sohn, Harvard U.; George Aronstein, Belgian League for the Rights of Man; see also next entry for info.

title: Exploring the child's world III
description: Interviews with delinquent and disturbed young people who are encouraged to discuss their experiences and express feelings. To protect individuals, each program is a re-creation of an actual interview using different names and places.

title: Twentieth century America: Its folk and popular music
Roots of jazz
description: Music-documentary series in 26 parts, covering various aspects of jazz.

title: Heritage of American humor
description: Dramatic essays on the history and nature of American humor. Written by J.F.S. Smeall, assistant professor of English at the University of North Dakota and editor of the North Dakota Quarterly.

title: Firing Line
description: An American public affairs show founded and hosted by William Buckley, Jr.

title: Hazards to education
description: Walgreen Lecture series on the present hazards to American education as seen and presented by Robert M. Hutchins.  Each lecture discusses one particular problem.

title: Listen America
description: A series of 13 programs featuring the works of selected contemporary American authors.

title: News in 20th century America
description: A radio series on the gathering, writing, and dissemination of news. Compiled from interviews with men and women who make news their business.

title: Improvisation Chamber Ensemble
description: Series of performances by Wayne State U. Improvisation Chamber Ensemble, which was organized in 1966 by Dr. Ruth Shaw Wylie, as an experiment in teaching contemporary techniques to advanced composition students. Refer also to blue spiral book under 67-29.

title: Mortimer Adler lectures
description: Series of five lectures by Dr. Mortimer J. Adler, Director of the Institute for Philosophic Research in Chicago. Title of lecture series: "The Difference of Man and the Difference It Makes."

title: Behavioral science research
description: A documentary series on behavioral science and its role in understanding human health.

title: Peninsula Music Festival
description: Live concert performances from the Peninsula Music Festival in Door County, Wisconsin.

title: Sounds of poverty
description: A documentary series featuring interviews with rural Appalachia residents by one hundred students from twenty-nine colleges, meeting at Action for Appalachian Youth Conference at Ripley, West Virginia. The series is hosted by Bert Cowlin.

title: Writer and the welfare state
description: A group of writers from various parts of the world gather in Copenhagen to discuss the place of the writer in modern society.

title: The smoking dilemma
description: For series info, see Item 3735. This prog.: Development of the Smoking Habit. Richard Carney, Ph.D., California Western U., president, San Diego County Psychological Association

title: New world of atomic energy
description: About peacetime uses of atomic energy, with experts from Oak Ridge and other atomic energy centers.

title: Youth on a four day trip
description: This series focuses on teenagers and various aspects of their health.

title: China: Policy and perspective
description: A series of talks from the University of Chicago dealing with current events in China.

title: Last citizen
description: A series of programs devoted to exploring the problems facing African-Americans and how these issues impact all Americans.

title: Automation and technological change
description: Discussions of the implications of automation and technological change.

title: Books in the news
description: A quick look at newly published material and books of current interest.

title: Conversations on public relations
description: A series of informal half-hour discussions on the nature and ethics of public relations. Series is hosted by Philip Lesly, editor of the Public Relations Handbook.

title: Prospect of a union
description: A first-hand account of the founding of the United States, described through the correspondence of John and Abigail Adams.

title: March of medicine
description: Dramatizations of great moments in medical history.

title: 1968 National Association of Educational Broadcasters convention
Music and other four letter words
The circumstance of science
description: The Circumstance of Science. Documentary series. No information available.

title: World of the Paperback
description: This series is dedicated to the discussion of literary topics and of the publication of significant paperbound books.

title: As we see it: Vietnam '68
description: Lecture/debate series on aspects of the war in Vietnam and Southeast Asia. This prog.: Dr. Walter Judd, a former U.S. Congressman and delegate to the General Assembly of the United Nations; also a former medical missionary in mainland China.

title: Japan: 1868-1968
description: Lecture series on centennial of beginning of modernization of Japan, featuring John M. Maki, U. of Massachusetts. This prog.: Japan and Modernization

title: Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra
description: This series presents performances by the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra from its 1963 season.

title: Voices of Europe
description: Interviews with noted Europeans on a variety of subjects, conducted by Milton Mayer, American author and broadcaster, lecturer and professor in the Institute of Social Research at Frankfurt University.

title: Lincoln as a social prophet
description: Lincoln as a Social Prophet. A series of readings prepared and delivered by Marvin Ceynar, speech instructor at Northern Illinois U. Readings are from letters and speeches by Lincoln. This prog.: what Place Violence in a Democracy?

title: Your rights are on trial
description: Discussions and dramatizations of recent high court decisions.  Features Professors of Law Monrad Paulsen of Columbia University and Charles Alan Wright of University of Texas.

title: Law in the news
description: This series focuses on current news stories that relate to the law.

title: Ernest Bloch: The man and his music
description: Documentary/music series about the life and work of the late Swiss composer Ernest Bloch, featuring his daughter, Suzanne, of The Julliard School of Music. With her commentary are readings by actors, including Robert Morris. More info next entry.

title: Ancient European organs
description: Recordings of noted organs at various locations throughout Europe.

title: The Institute on Man and Science
description: A lecture and discussion series on major current problems like urban decay; pollution; space exploration; and the role of science in finding solutions. Talks were held during the summer of 1968 at the Institute on Man and Science, New York.

title: Exploring the child's world
description: Interviews with delinquent and disturbed young people who are encouraged to discuss their experiences and express feelings. To protect individuals, each program is a re-creation of an actual interview using different names and places.

title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters Convention
As others read us: American fiction abroad
description: This series analyzes European views of the works of American authors.

title: Music now
description: A series focused on American composers of the mid-Twentieth century.

title: William Allen White
description: Documentary-drama commemorating the 100th anniversary of the birth of journalist William Allen White.

title: The wandering ballad singer
description: Folk music series hosted by musician Barre Toelken, who collects folk songs and has worked as a dance band musician, a Forest Service employee, and prospector.

title: My own master
description: Documentary-drama commemorating the 100th anniversary of the birth of journalist William Allen White.

title: The comic arts II
description: Essays and interviews on the nature and scope of humor in America. Program consultant for the series: George Q. Lewis of the Humor Societies of America. See also series 68-12. This prog.: Harold Lloyd: The Golden Silents.

title: Pacific portraits
description: This series explores various aspects of the Pacific region through dramatization, narration, commentary and music.

title: The world of the conductor
description: A series of interviews with leading symphonic conductors about aspects of symphonic music and their profession.

title: The border in question
description: Documentary series on U.S.-Canadian relations, from a Canadian point of view.

title: Monteverdi
description: A discussion of the work of Monteverdi, hosted by Newell Jenkins and featuring musical illustrations.

title: Split the lark and you'll hear the music
description: A special that focuses on the poetry and letters of 19th century American poet Emily Dickinson.

title: Oral essays on education
description: The thoughts of distinguished Americans in a survey of American eduction.

title: Where minds meet
description: A series of discussions exploring world of speech, conducted by Professors John Freund and Arnold Nelson of Western Michigan University

title: To every man his due
description: Dramatic-narrative series on principles of justice under the American system of law, particularly the rights of defendants.

title: Scrolls from the Dead Sea
description: The story of the Dead Sea Scrolls, featuring interviews with 30 leading scholars, scientists, archeologists and theologians.

title: Man and the value of life
The American people
description: This series examines contemporary American issues through interviews and personal essays.

title: Metaphysical roots of the drama
description: Lectures given at the Hebrew Union College-Jewish Institute of Religion at Cincinnati by Robert Brustein, Dean of the Yale School of Drama. This prog.: Aeschylus and the Origins of the Greek Ritual

title: Ruffled feathers: The Dakota Sioux
description: A documentary series about the history, culture and contemporary problems of the Sioux, a Native American tribe.

title: NHK Symphony Hall
description: A series of symphonic performances recorded at the NHK Hall in Tokyo, Japan

title: Dilemmas of power
description: This series presents a variety of lectures on Soviet-American relations that were given at the Milton S. Eisenhower Symposium in Baltimore, MD. The lectures are followed by informal question and answer sessions.

title: Composer in the world of today
description: How the composer of today sees the contemporary world around him. Interviews, commentary and musical illustration provide a better picture of the modern composer. The series is hosted by Burrill Phillips, composer and professor of music at the University of Illinois.

title: The next fifty years
description: Series of lectures recorded in Autumn 1967 at the American Institute of Planners Conference, Washington, D.C. Emphasis on city planning, housing, architecture, recreation, transportation for next 50 years. This prog.: See next entry.

title: The story of a masterpiece
description: Semi-dramatic series about famous French masterpiece stories, produced by French Cultural Services, as part of its project Various Aspects of French Life. This prog.: J. Gericault: The Raft of the Medusa.

title: Christmas Special 1969
description: A special radio program produced at the University of Michigan to celebrate the 1969 Christmas season.

title: CSAA Annual Conference: Sexual behavior and social ethics
Amang the Scots
description: A documentary series about modern Scotland.

title: Speaking of Mexico: English
description: This series discusses issues related to Mexican life, government, and culture. This is the English-language version of Speaking Of Mexico.

title: The inner core: City within a city
description: Documentary series on urban conditions for residents of the Inner Core of Milwaukee, Wisconsin. This prog.: Mass Media and Urban Turbulence. Singer Buchanan of Eastern Michigan U. and Prof. Stanley Donner, U. of Texas.

title: The comic arts
description: Series devoted to humor, humorists and comedy writing in America. This prog.: Sam Levinson, George Q. Lewis, Danny Thomas, Robert Orben.

title: As I roved out
description: Hosted by folksinger Jean Ritchie, As I Roved Out explores folk music of America and the British Isles and the people who make it.

title: Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra 1971
description: This series features live performances from the 1971 season by the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra .

title: The shadow of the lion
description: Documentary series on influences of change in Great Britain (England, United Kingdom). This prog.: An introduction depicting Britain's current plight, influences of change, and the growing conflict between tradition and 20th century needs.

title: Window on the world
description: A series of short talks by well-known British personalities on the subjects usually associated with them.

title: The story of education
description: This series presents various excerpts from the book, "The Story of Education," which traces the evolution of education. The excerpts are read by the book's co-author, Dr. Carroll Atkinson.

title: British general election
description: The outcome of the 1964 general election in Great Britain is explored by various journalists and politicians.

title: And the world listened
description: This series presents dramatizations of famous speeches.

title: Unknown symphonic recording
description: An unknown performance of symphonic classical music

title: Kaleidoscope
description: A series of close-ups of the American art scene.

title: Your Congress today
description: This series explores the relationships between the Congress and the Supreme Court and the Presidency.

title: Coming of age
description: Explores the thoughts and feelings of American youth in the 20th century. Writer-director Ben Park talks with teenagers and parents, teachers and friends.

title: About science
description: Interview series on variety of science-related subjects, produced by the California Institute of Technology. Features three Cal Tech faculty members: Dr. Peter Lissaman, Dr. Albert R. Hibbs, and Dr. Robert Meghreblian.

title: Pollution explosion
description: A discussion of environment-related issues.

title: Why is a writer?
description: Produced by the Iowa School of the Air, this series focuses on various works of literature from Shakespeare to Twain.

title: The American woman in fact and fiction
description: This series, written and directed by Virginia Maynard, dramatizes various stories of women from colonial times to the Twentieth century.

title: The Chicago lectures
description: This series presents lectures given at University of Chicago, focusing on the nature of human beings, their place in the universe, and their potentialities. The lectures were also published in The Bulletin of Atomic Scientists, beginning in September 1965.

title: Astronomy for the layman
description: Six programs on astronomy featuring Leon E. Salanave, lecturer in astronomy at Morrison Planetarium in San Francisco, and John Hopkins, interviewer.  Produced with cooperation of California Academy of Sciences.

title: People or puppets?
description: Discussions of values and ethics, modern versus traditional. Faculty from Union Theological Seminary, authors Kenneth Burke and Geoffrey Wagner, critics Edmund Fuller and Martin Dworkin, Dr. Solon Kimball and broadcaster Edward Stanley are featured.

title: European review
description: European Review #393, recorded May 27, 1969.

title: Man and the multitude
description: A lecture series commemorating the centennial of the University of Illinois.

title: Special of the week
description: Special of the Week #4. Centennial of Italy unification: ceremony at Library of Congress.

title: Challenges in education
description: Series that presents problems facing educators today. Recent subjects have been 'The Computer in Medicine,' 'Climate for Learning,' 'Teacher Unrest,' 'Teacher Evaluation,' 'Vacuum Propulsion.'

title: They bent our ear
description: Dramatic readings of 14 travelers who came to the United States in 1820-1850 and wrote of what they saw.

title: U.S. foreign policy: Demands of the next
description: Recorded speeches from the 1968 Portland, Oregon, conference sponsored by the World Affairs Council of Oregon, Foreign Policy Association, and Time magazine. This prog.: American Broadcasting Company News commentator Joseph C. Harsch discusses NATO and other western alliances.

title: NER Washington Forum
description: Discussion series featuring a prominent figure affecting federal government policy.

title: Canada '67
description: This series focuses on Canada's Expo '67 celebration and other events celebrating the 100th anniversary of the founding of Canada.

title: The truth about radio
description: A series that features interviews with important figures in the radio industry.

title: The march of medicine
description: Drama series highlighting important moments in medicine. Each program also includes a public service announcement related to medicine or hospitals.

title: The piano sonatas of Haydn
description: Illustrated lecture series featuring 34 piano sonatas of Haydn as demonstrated by Canadian pianist Raymond Dudley, Concert Artist in Residence at the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory.
